poem:
### Evening Broadcast

Gaza flickers nightly, a screen  
where Abdullah, just thirteen,  
weaves through crumbling stories—  
his voice a thread of indifference,  
while Renad, whisk in hand, pauses,  
bomb whispering new recipes.

The unimaginable, mundane  
wrapped in a cocoon of headlines,  
worlds caught between whisk  
and war, life's edges fraying silently.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "TV tonight: a vital film about young people in Gaza Gaza: How to Survive a Warzone 9pm, BBC TwoA teenager narrates this absolutely vital film about what life has been like for young people in Gaza since 7 October 2023. Abdullah, 13, is incisive, quick on his feet and at times alarmingly indifferent as he shows the horrors around him. We also meet cooking TikToker Renad, 10, who stops whisking when a bomb hits nearby:". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
